page.title: 02PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content:
E FEATURES
The area of our study is bounded by the River Severn on the eastern edge and a ridge of high land running down from Kempsey Common. The settlements are mainly agricultural from Clifton in the south to the southern edge of Kempsey in the north. Kempsey is by far the biggest settlement. The name Kempsey is taken from the local British chieftan Kemys who lived in the area before the Romans arrived. Kempsey Common dominates the surrounding area .It has been seered from Kempsey by the M5 motorway but still gives beautiful views of the local countryside.Today the river is used mostly by pleasure craft though a few small industrial barges come up river from Gloucester.
